This is a chat only number. true false false false false false false false false false Powered By Digit Digit Insurance Explore Spiritual Places in India Temples in Pune Switch to Digit Insurance Quick Claim Process Affordable Premium Check Premium Check Premium Top 9 Famous Temples in Pune to Visit Pune, a metropolitan city in Maharashtra, is known for its educational institutions and beautiful ancient temples. Pune has served as a sacred place for spiritual significance, and the temples here are known to play a pivotal role. If you plan a day trip to Pune, these famous temples are a must-visit add to the list. Along with devotion, the place is filled with historical structures and stories. Team Digit Table of Contents Best Temples to Visit in Pune Omkareshwar Temple Parvati Hill Temple Neelkanteshwar Temple Dagadusheth Halwai Ganpati Temple Kasba Ganpati Temple Shri Chatushrungi Temple Shri Ram Mandir Tulsibug ISKCON Temple Shri Siddhivinayak Ganesh Temple Frequently Asked Questions List of Temples in Pune Following is the list of temples in Pune that are easily accessible via Pune Junction Railway Station, Swargate Bus Station and Pune International Airport. Temples Location Omkareshwar Temple Shaniwar Peth Parvati Hill Temple Parvati Paytha Neelkanteshwar Temple Kondhur Dagadusheth Halwai Ganpati Temple Ganpati Bhawan Kasba Ganpati Temple Kasba Peth Shri Chatushrungi Temple Gokhalenagar Shri Ram Mandir Tulsibaug Budhwar Peth ISKCON Temple Kondhwa Budruk Shri Siddhivinayak Ganesh Temple Sarasbaug Know more about: Hill stations near Pune One day trip from Pune 9 Best Temples to Visit in Pune Here is the list of the best temples you must add to your bucket list while exploring Pune. 1. Omkareshwar Temple | Shaniwar Peth Omkareshwar temple is one of the biggest and famous temples in Pune. It is one of the ancient temples that was built during Peshwa's rule. Dedicated to Lord Shiva, the temple’s architecture is breathtaking. Best Time to Visit: June to August. Temple Timings: 5:30 am to 11 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places to Visit: Sambhaji Park, Shaniwar Wada, Raja Dinkar Kelkar Museum. 2. Parvati Hill Temple | Parvati Paytha The temple is located on top of the hill, and one has to climb 103 steps to reach it. The place provides tranquillity and scenic beauty to visitors. The view of the city is breathtaking from the top of the hill. Best Time to Visit: August to February. Temple Timings: 8 am to 5 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places to Visit: Sarasbaug, Peshwe Udyan Zoo, Zapurva Museum of Art and Culture.   Read more about: Places to visit in Pune Waterfalls near Pune 3. Neelkanteshwar Temple | Kondhur The temple is located 900 metres above sea level, featuring the idol of Lord Shiva with a blue neck. One has to trek to reach the temple, making the journey worthwhile and offering beautiful scenery. Best Time to Visit: June to October. Temple Timings: 5 am to 9 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places to Visit: Panchet Dam, Khadakwasla Dam. 4. Dagadusheth Halwai Ganpati Temple | Ganpati Bhavan The temple was built by a sweet seller, Dagadusheth Dalve hence the name is given in his reference. The temple features a 7.5-foot-tall idol of Lord Ganesha adorned with gold and jewellery, even visible from the outside. Best Time to Visit: August to October. Temple Timings: 6 am to 10:30 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places to Visit: Darshan Museum, Amanora Mall, Kavadi Pat.   Know more about: Road trips from Pune Weekend getaways from Pune Wildlife Safari near Pune 5. Kasba Ganpati Temple | Kasba Peth The temple has historical significance as it was founded by the mother of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, Queen Jijabai. Since then the temple has been visited by many devotees over the years. Best Time to Visit: August to February. Temple Timings: 6 am to 9 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places to Visit: Joshis Museum of Miniature Railways, Lal Mahal, Shaniwar Wada. 6. Shri Chatushrungi Temple | Gokhalenagar It is one of the famous temples in Pune dedicated to Chatushringi Mata built during the reign of Shivaji Maharaj. It is a 90-foot tall temple with 100 steps to ascend. The environment is full of spiritual vibes. Best Time to Visit: August to February. Temple Timings: 6 am to 8:30 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places to Visit: Pataleshwar Cave, Darshan Museum, Raja Dinkar Kelkar Museum. 7. Shri Ram Mandir Tulsibaug | Budhwar Peth Shri Ram Mandir was also constructed during Peshwa's reign. The temple features the idols of Lord Ram, Sita, and Laxmana. There is also the idol of Lord Hanuman bowing before Lord Ram. Best Time to Visit: March to April. Temple Timings: 10 am to 1 pm and 4 pm to 9 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places to Visit: National War Museum, Darshan Museum, Chakan Fort. 8. ISKCON Temple | Kondhwa Budruk The temple is surrounded by lush greenery and verdant hills. It features the awestruck idols of Lord Krishna and Goddess Radha. Every wall of the temple is meticulously carved with Vedic texts, including the Bhagavad Gita. Best Time to Visit: August to February. Temple Timings: 4:30 am to 8:40 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places to Visit: National Defense Academy, Bhimashankar Wildlife Sanctuary, Sarasbaug. 9. Shri Siddhivinayak Ganesh Temple | Sarasbaug The temple is situated at the foot of Parvati hills surrounded by the lake. Dedicated to Lord Ganesh, the temple is again from the times of Peshwa's reign, one of the spectacular temples in Pune. Best Time to Visit: August to February. Temple Timings: 6 am to 8:30 pm - Everyday. Nearby Places to Visit: Osho Garden, Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj Garden, Sarasbaug. There are many more small temples and forts in Pune that you can visit. Be it the Dagadusheth temple, popular among youngsters or the Neelkanteshwar temple among elders, Pune provides a centre to visitors for their devotion. These temples are a must-visit if you visit Pune during the festive seasons. No, most of the temples in Pune do not charge any entry fee but there might be charges for Darshan and guided tours to the temples. No, most of the temples in Pune do not charge any entry fee but there might be charges for Darshan and guided tours to the temples. Which is the best time to visit temples in Pune? The best time to visit temples in Pune is during or after monsoon as the weather remains slightly chilly for one to explore the scenic beauty around temples. The best time to visit temples in Pune is during or after monsoon as the weather remains slightly chilly for one to explore the scenic beauty around temples. What is the significance of Dagadusheth Halwai Temple in Pune? Dagadusheth Halwai Temple is the richest temple in Pune and holds religious significance for devotees all over the country. It is believed that the wishes are fulfilled in this temple. Dagadusheth Halwai Temple is the richest temple in Pune and holds religious significance for devotees all over the country. It is believed that the wishes are fulfilled in this temple. Which is the most famous temple in Pune? Kasba Ganpati and Dagadusheth Halwai Temple is the most famous temple in Pune as Lord Ganesh is considered one of the presiding deities of the city. Kasba Ganpati and Dagadusheth Halwai Temple is the most famous temple in Pune as Lord Ganesh is considered one of the presiding deities of the city. Are the accommodation facilities available near temples in Pune? Yes, various accommodation facilities like hotels, guest rooms, hostels and lodges are available near temples in Pune. Yes, various accommodation facilities like hotels, guest rooms, hostels and lodges are available near temples in Pune. Are photography and videography allowed inside the temples in Pune? No, photography is not allowed inside most of the temples. But it may not be an issue for some temples. No, photography is not allowed inside most of the temples. But it may not be an issue for some temples. Can visitors easily reach these temples through public transportation? Yes, Pune is well-connected in terms of transportation. You can reach these temples by bus, train, or auto-rickshaw, which are easily accessible. Yes, Pune is well-connected in terms of transportation. You can reach these temples by bus, train, or auto-rickshaw, which are easily accessible. What is the ISKCON temple in Pune famous for? ISKCON Temple in Pune is one of the biggest temples in Pune spread across 6 acres. ISKCON Temple in Pune is one of the biggest temples in Pune spread across 6 acres. What are the nearby places to visit in Pune along with temples? The nearby attraction sites to visit in Pune are Raja Dinkar Kelkar Museum, Zapurva Museum of Art and Culture, Shaniwar Wada, Pataleshwar Cave and Bhimashankar Wildlife Sanctuary. The nearby attraction sites to visit in Pune are Raja Dinkar Kelkar Museum, Zapurva Museum of Art and Culture, Shaniwar Wada, Pataleshwar Cave and Bhimashankar Wildlife Sanctuary. Which wish-fulfilling temple is in Pune? Dagadusheth Halwai Ganpati Temple is popularly considered a wish-fulfilling temple. Devotees whisper in the ears of Ganpati to fulfil their wishes. Dagadusheth Halwai Ganpati Temple is popularly considered a wish-fulfilling temple. Devotees whisper in the ears of Ganpati to fulfil their wishes. How can visitors reach Parvati Hill in Pune? Visitors can simply climb 103 steps to reach Parvati Hill in Pune. It takes nearly 15-20 mins to climb the stairs. Visitors can simply climb 103 steps to reach Parvati Hill in Pune. It takes nearly 15-20 mins to climb the stairs. What are the must-visit temples in Pune? Some of the must-visit temples in Pune are Swaminarayan Temple, Omkareshwar Temple, and Chatushrungi Mata Temple.
